course.title: Contemporary Issues in Psychology: Intensive Cross-level Analyses
course.faculty_text: Mahzarin R. Banaji and members of the Department
course.description: Examines selected issues and phenomena in contemporary psychological research. Special attention to examining topics from a variety of perspectives, to reading primary sources in the field, and to developing thinking, writing, research, and discussion skills. This tutorial, or Psychology 975, is required of concentrators upon entering the concentration, normally in the sophomore year. Letter graded.
course.prerequisites: Science of Living Systems 20 (or equivalent) or concurrent enrollment. Stat 101 or PSY 1900 as a pre- or corequisite.
course.notes: This course is taught entirely in sections, so a required first meeting of this course will be held the first day of classes; see Registrar's first meeting list for time and location. Students may take this course before formally declaring Psychology as their concentration.
